headline.print_headline: How the Dow Jones Industrial Average Did Monday
headline.main: How the Dow Jones Industrial Average Did Monday

lead_paragraph: The stock market couldn't shake off a case of the jitters from last week and closed sharply lower again on Monday. Airlines, energy and materials stocks were among the biggest decliners. The market is coming off its biggest weekly decline in more than two years. The Standard & Poor's 500 index is 6.8 percent below its September peak.
